A tool to understand Cohen's d standardi: A tool to understand Cohen's d standardized effect size
twitterShareCohend: Interpretando o d de Cohen - uma visualização interativa por @krstoff
Tip double-click chart to rescale: Tip: clique duas vezes no gráfico para redimensionar
license: Versão {{version}}, última actualização {{lastUpdated}}. Licenses: MIT (<5>source code</5>), a visualização é CC0, e o conteúdo de texto é CC-BY 4.0.
guideStart: <0>Como usar esta aplicação</0>This is a guided help tour that will highlight the app's functionality.
guideSlider: Use this slider to change Cohen's <3>d. Try dragging it!
guideSettings: <0>You can view and change the visualization's settings by clicking this icon.<1>Protip: you can save these settings so they persist across visits. Just click the save icon at the bottom of the settings panel.
guideSaveSVG: <0>Download a copy of the visualization (in SVG).<1>This image is released under a CC0 license ("No rights reserved"), meaning that you can copy, modify, and distribute the image, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission (although, attribution is appreciated!).
guideDiff: This is the difference between the groups on the unstandardized scale (the raw difference).
guideU3: Cohen's U<1>3</1> is the proportion of the group to the right that is above the mean of the group to the left.
guidePropOverlap: This shows the percentage of the total number of scores that overlap.
guideCL: This is probability that a person picked at random from the treatment group will have a higher score than a person picked at random from the control group.
guideNNT: <0>This is the number of patients, on average, that we need to treat in order to have one more favorable outcome in the treatment group compared to the control group.<1>NNT depends on the control event rate (CER), which is represented by the darker path in this figure. This can be changed in the settings.
